meanings.definition: To stretch out or extend in a straight line.
meanings.sent1: She streeks her arms out to reach the high shelf.
meanings.sent2: The cat streeks its body along the sunny patch on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The tree streeks its branches towards the sky, trying to touch the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The river streeks through the valley, cutting a path between the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The painter carefully streeks the colors across the canvas, creating a beautiful landscape.

meanings.definition: A long narrow area or stretch of land.
meanings.sent1: The farm had vast streeks of green fields under the blue sky.
meanings.sent2: We hiked through the streeks of desert, feeling the heat on our skin.
meanings.sent3: The map showed the streeks of forest where the hidden treasure might be buried.
meanings.sent4: The old castle overlooked the streeks of rolling hills and meadows.
meanings.sent5: The explorer set off to discover the mysterious streeks of the jungle, filled with unknown creatures.

meanings.sent1: The children streeks across the playground, laughing and playing tag.
meanings.sent2: The deer streeks through the forest, leaping gracefully over fallen logs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel streeks up the tree, trying to escape from the curious dog.
meanings.sent4: The athlete streeks towards the finish line, determined to win the race.
meanings.sent5: The wind streeks through the open field, carrying the scent of wildflowers.
